intro: Pholidota vaginata, commonly known as the Indian banyan, is a large, deciduous tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It is characterized by its massive, buttressed trunk and extensive aerial roots that form a network of支柱, supporting its sprawling canopy. The tree produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes, and its fruit is a three-lobed, woody capsule containing numerous seeds. Pholidota vaginata is well adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in humid environments with well-drained soil. It plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
